medical_history.chief_complaint: Diarrhea and abdominal pain for 1 week.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient developed epigastric abdominal pain one week prior to admission, which then radiated to the lower abdomen. The abdominal pain is associated with brown diarrhea occurring daily. Symptoms slightly improved after treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history:
1. Hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia
2. Prostate cancer status post prostatectomy with scrotal implant
3. Myoclonic jerks of unclear etiology, treated with Klonopin
4. Mild L5-S1 radiculopathy on right
5. Arthritis
6. History of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
7. Status post right lower lobe pneumonectomy related to HHT
8. Urinary incontinence
9. Depression
10. Mild deafness
medical_history.family_history: Father had lung disease/CHF; mother had hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia; brother had a myocardial infarction.
